TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TaskPane extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the task pane that is associated with the current window in Microsoft InfoPath.

remarks.para: The TaskPane class provides properties for working with the InfoPath built-in task panes. The class inherits these properties for working with a custom task pane.

The properties available for an InfoPath task pane are determined by the type of task pane that you are working with. If the property returns TaskPaneType.Html, the task pane is a custom task pane and the properties and methods available are provided by the HtmlTaskPane class. If the TaskPaneType property returns any other value, the task pane is a built-in task pane and the properties are provided by the TaskPane object.

Note: TaskPaneType property returns values defined by the enumeration. These enumerated values are also used as arguments to the property of the class for returning a reference to a specified type of task pane.

example.para: The following example sets a reference to the TaskPane object in the TaskPaneCollection with the value of 3, displays its TaskPaneType value (ClipArt), and then displays the Clip Art task pane.
example.code: Dim myTaskPane As TaskPane = Me.TaskPanes(3) MessageBox.Show(myTaskPane.TaskPaneType.ToString()) myTaskPane.Visible = true

Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property TaskPaneType As TaskPaneType
public: abstract property Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::TaskPaneType TaskPaneType { Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::TaskPaneType get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating the type of task pane represented by the object.
Docs.value: A value that indicates the type of task pane represented by the object.

remarks.para: If the TaskPaneType property returns TaskPaneType.Html, the task pane is a custom task pane. If the TaskPaneType property returns any other TaskPaneType enumerated value, the task pane is a built-in task pane.

Note: TaskPaneType property returns values defined by the TaskPaneType enumeration. These enumerated values are also used as arguments to the property of the class for returning a reference to a specified type of task pane.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool Visible { get; set; }
Public MustOverride Property Visible As Boolean
public: abstract property bool Visible { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Visible : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the task pane represented by the object is visible in the Microsoft InfoPath user interface.
Docs.value: true if the task pane is visible; otherwise false.

remarks.para: Setting the Visible property to true causes the task pane to appear in the user interface, and setting it to false causes it to be removed from the user interface.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.
